habitat_description:
Found in northwest Louisiana and west Arkansas to central Oklahoma and south Texas. Disjunct population in north central Arkansas (Conant and Collins 1998). 
Preferred habitat is savanna and wooded areas, but in Texas can also be found utilizing arid terrain (Conant and Collins 1998). The Hurter’s spadefoot can be found in sandy, gravelly, or soft, and light soils. Habitat can be sparsely to densely vegetated such as sandy open woodlands, savannah, or mesquite scrub (Bartlett and Bartlett 1999).


Found in temporary pools along riparian corridors. Terrestrial habitats include herbaceous grassland, savanna, chaparral, shrubland, and hardwood to mixed woodlands.
